author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Puducherry Milk Producers Union on Monday said that producers plan to stage a novel protest.

They informed that they will organise a demonstration along with their cattle on the arterial Jawaharlal Nehru Street in support of their demands.

This also includes filling up of vacant posts of veterinary doctors.

Speaking to reporters, R. Krishnan, president of the union said that shortage of veterinary doctors was coming in the way of ensuring quality services. This had increased the workload of the existing staff.

As many as 25 posts of veterinary doctors and over 40 posts of veterinary assistants with the department of animal husbandry were also vacant.

The Union has also demanded that the Government should ensure adequate supply of medicines at Veterinary hospitals and impound cattle which have been freely roaming in the municipal areas.
title: Milk producers union to stage protest
